newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish BDK bank registers unit in Ukraine.
newsitem.headline: Polish BDK bank registers unit in Ukraine.

text.p: A subsidiary of Polish Bank Depozytowo-Kredytowy SA (BDK) has been registered by the Ukrainian National Bank, BDK's spokesman said on Wednesday.
PAP news agency quoted Marek Gedek as saying that Bank Depozytowo-Kredytowy Ukraina Ltd would begin operations within one month and plans to employ 30 people at the start.
BDK Ukraina has a share capital of five million Ecu with 35 percent shares owned directly by the parent bank and the remainder through two Polish firms controlled by BDK.
BDK, along with two other state-owned commercial banks, was grouped under Polish banking giant Pekao SA at the end of 1996, with the whole group slated for privatisation in 1998.
